Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, one land-based and one water-based, but with limited details.
The student can depict a few living things in each habitat, such as one or two trees and an animal like a squirrel in the land habitat, and one fish in the water habitat.
CANNOT: The student may not be able to clearly depict a wide variety of living things in each habitat (e.g., might only draw personal favorites like dogs or cats regardless of the habitat).

The student might not demonstrate a clear understanding of the diversity of life by missing important differences between the living things in each habitat (e.g., drawing same types of plants in both habitats).

The student may struggle to use the drawings to accurately compare and describe patterns of plant and animal diversity between the two habitats (e.g., misses showing unique features of water plants versus land plants).
